link.synopsis: It's love at first sight for Alec Baldwin and Meg Ryan. Within days of meeting, they're walking down the aisle, and a strange thing happens: An old man shows up and kisses the bride. Then, on the honeymoon, Baldwin begins to suspect that the woman he's with isn't the person he married. Screenwriter Craig Lucas' comedy is a thought-provoking mix of romance and philosophy.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Mafioso Paul Vitti (Robert De Niro) is released into the custody of his overworked psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal), much to the dismay of the doctor's wife (Lisa Kudrow). Despite Ben's attempts to help Paul stick to the straight and narrow, Paul's old mob buddies are after him. In a bind, Ben must try some unconventional techniques to sort things out, especially since Paul's now living in his house. Harold Ramis directs this comedy sequel.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Feeling spurned after being cut from the national team due to her age, newly single softball player Lisa (Reese Witherspoon) finds herself in the middle of a heated love triangle, as a professional baseball player (Owen Wilson) and a business executive (Paul Rudd) compete for her affections. Jack Nicholson co-stars in this athletically minded romantic comedy from acclaimed writer-director James L. Brooks (As Good As It Gets).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Based on a true story, this intense thriller follows housewife Victoria, who, after moving into a new neighborhood with her husband and teenage daughter, becomes suspicious that the man next door is keeping family members prisoner in his basement.
link.title: synopsis
Shadow Island Mysteries: The Last Christmas

link.synopsis: In 2003, the U.S. government allocated an astounding $12 million to apprehend the elusive Tommy Chong -- better known as half of the classic comedy team Cheech and Chong -- for selling bong-like glass pipes over the Internet. In this fascinating documentary featuring interviews with Richard "Cheech" Marin, Jay Leno and Bill Maher, filmmaker Josh Gilbert chronicles the sting that came to be known as "Operation Pipe Dream."
link.title: synopsis
High: The True Tale of American Marijuana
American Drug War: The Last White Hope
The Union: The Business Behind Getting High
Martial Arts Master: The Life of Bruce Lee
Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson
This Film Is Not Yet Rated
Graffiti Verite 1: Read the Writing on the Wall

link.synopsis: In this diverting romantic comedy, Harry -- an Indian-American who believes true love is a sham -- happily plans for an arranged marriage to an Indian woman he's never met ... until his friendship with a sexy American lady takes an unexpected turn.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Kathleen Madigan of "Last Comic Standing" busts her comedy moves in this special filmed at the Gramercy Theater in New York. With her wry observations on family and the quirks of American life, Madigan gets the audience roaring. The comic mines her Missouri roots for material but is never meanspirited as she pokes fun at being the cynical one in the family and rubbing married friends' noses in the joys of being single.
link.title: synopsis
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing

Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid

link.synopsis: Television executive R.J. Fletcher (Kevin McCarthy) tries to sabotage the wild success of a rival low-rent, wacky station run by slovenly dreamer George Newman (Weird Al Yankovic) and Bob (David Bowe) -- leading to a telethon showdown. Only George's on-air local misfits can help save the day. Jay Levey directs, and Victoria Jackson, Stanley Brock and Michael Richards co-star in this daring, out-there, over-the-top comedy.
link.title: synopsis
To Be or Not To Be

link.synopsis: Director Peter Berg's dark comedy chronicles a bachelor party gone horribly wrong. Kyle (Jon Favreau) and his pals are off to Vegas to celebrate Kyle's upcoming marriage to Laura (Cameron Diaz) when things take a decidedly bad turn. After an accidental death, murder and cover-up, guilt starts to take its toll. As the body count rises, ex-pal Robert (Christian Slater) inadvertently proves that a bride will do anything to have her dream wedding.
link.title: synopsis
How to Be a Serial Killer
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: Visioneer George Washington Winsterhammerman (Zach Galifianakis) lives a comfortable but monotonous life in this slightly futuristic black comedy. But when people start exploding from stress and George is showing early symptoms, he's forced to examine his life. Taking a look at his prestigious job, his sexless marriage and his resistance to life coaching, George reconsiders the philosophy of happiness through mindless activity.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
How to Be a Serial Killer
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Days before his pregnant wife's due date, Los Angeles architect Peter (Robert Downey Jr.) is about to fly home from Atlanta when a series of unfortunate incidents land him on the "no-fly" list, forcing him to hitch a ride across the country with slacker Ethan (Zach Galifianakis). As Peter desperately tries to get home, he must deal with Ethan's laid-back attitude, numerous delays and several mishaps in this road trip comedy. Jamie Foxx co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: Capt. Yossarian (Alan Arkin) tries to escape the travesties of World War II by convincing his Air Force commanders that he's crazy. Hilarity ensues -- but so does reality as he watches his close friends (Martin Sheen and Art Garfunkel) die in the ridiculousness of war. Mike Nichols directs this cinematic adaptation of Joseph Heller's scathing black comedy about a small group of flyers in the Mediterranean in 1944.
link.title: synopsis
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
The Charge of the Light Brigade

link.synopsis: Gritty ex-Marine Ellie De Witt (Rebecca De Mornay) and cerebral Janis Zuckerman (Mary Gross) set out to become hard-nosed FBI agents in this satiric comedy (also starring Ken Marshall and Fred Dalton Thompson). But at the training academy, the women suffer demeaning, chauvinistic treatment at the hands of their superiors and the male trainees. With the odds against the ladies, they must learn to outshoot -- and outfox -- their sexist colleagues.
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Starz Inside: The Face Is Familiar

link.synopsis: Comedian Earthquake hosts and stars in this stand-up comedy special, which features six top comics dishing their outrageous takes on the election of Barack Obama to the White House in 2008 and the impact his presidency has had on America.
link.title: synopsis
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Donnell Rawlings: From Ashy to Classy
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security

Macho Men and the Women Who Love Them
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Diary of a Tired Black Man
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Five on the Black Hand Side

title.regular: Earthquake Presents: From the Outhouse to the White House
title.short: From the Outhouse to the White House

link.synopsis: As host of this hilarious Comedy Central showcase, Oscar-winning actor Jamie Foxx introduces audiences to some of the freshest urban comedians in the country. The seventh installment of a multivolume set features sidesplitting stand-up from James Hannah (a writer for Chris Rock's comedy album "Never Scared"), Joe Blount (OutFoxed), Jo Koy ("Showtime at the Apollo"), Loni Love (VH1's "I Love the 90s"), Luenell and Rob Stapleton.

Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore

link.synopsis: Doug Stanhope -- a no-holds-barred comedian known for his brutal honesty as well as his regular appearances on "The Howard Stern Show" -- delivers a memorable stand-up set in this live show taped at the Gotham Comedy Club in New York City. With a punk-rock attitude and a love of all things raucous and outrageous, Stanhope tackles a variety of taboo topics that are incredibly funny … but far from family-friendly!
link.title: synopsis
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin

Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project

link.synopsis: Lily (Loren Horsley) is reserved and awkward, while Jarrod (Jemaine Clement) is an introspective oddball who's blind to Lily's affection for him -- until a celebration mixed with a strange plan to exact revenge on Jarrod's high school foe brings the two misfits together. Oscar-nominated director Taika Cohen also penned this offbeat romantic comedy co-starring Joel Tobeck as Lily's brother and sounding board.
link.title: synopsis
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Nick Kroll: Thank You Very Cool

link.synopsis: Tonino's (Alfredo Pea) voluptuous aunt is driving him crazy, but he's just about put her out of his fantasies. That's when a sexy new teacher arrives at school, pushing Tonino and his classmates' adolescence into major overdrive. Two of Italy's most popular sex bombs of the 1970s -- Dagmar Lassander and Femi Benussi -- star in this fun, erotic romp. Gianfranco D'Angelo and Gabriele Di Giulio co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
What Have You Done to Solange?
Fatty Girl Goes to New York
Open Letter to the Evening News

link.synopsis: Mistaken for the character he plays in the Evil Dead films, B-movie icon Bruce Campbell (playing himself) is kidnapped by the citizens of a small mining town who want him to save them from a vengeful demon. At first, Campbell thinks it's all part of an elaborate prank. But when he realizes the demon is in fact real, he comes face to face with a second terrifying enemy -- his own fear. Ted Raimi co-stars in this tongue-in-cheek comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
Masters of Horror: John Landis: Family
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu
The Haunted World of El Superbeasto
Masters of Horror: Stuart Gordon: Dreams in the Witch House
Masters of Horror: Tobe Hooper: Dance of the Dead
Bachelor Party in the Bungalow of the Damned
Masters of Horror: Joe Dante: Homecoming
Masters of Horror: Dario Argento: Pelts
Masters of Horror: Peter Medak: The Washingtonians

Masters of Horror: Takashi Miike: Imprint

Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
Masters of Horror: Don Coscarelli: Incident On and Off a Mountain Road
Masters of Horror: Stuart Gordon: The Black Cat
Masters of Horror: Larry Cohen: Pick Me Up

link.synopsis: Hong Kong funnyman Stephen Chow plays real-life legendary figure So-Hat-Yi, the spoiled son of a millionaire who finds his dream girl and soul mate (Sharla Cheung) but must win a "Kung Fu Scholar" tournament to win her hand. Unfortunately, his victory ultimately leaves him destitute and homeless in this martial arts action-comedy from director Gordon Chan. Watch for stunt master Woo-ping Yuen in a cameo.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words
Kung Fu Mahjong 3: The Final Duel
Zu: Warriors From The Magic Mountain
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power

link.synopsis: In this quirky comedy, emotionally detached Carys Reitman (Bijou Phillips) has an unusual way of trying to connect with people when she's down in the dumps: She ventures to a nearby mortuary to attend the funerals of strangers. But after she meets handsome Tyler (Ian Somerhalder) -- at his fiancée's memorial service -- Carys finds herself developing feelings for a living person for the first time. Jane Seymour plays Carys' estranged mother.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Cary Grant and Ginger Rogers make a delicious screwball comedy team in this caper directed by Howard Hawks. Grant's a middle-aged fuddy-duddy who may have invented a fountain of youth serum in his laboratory. But when a rampaging chimp mixes it into the water cooler, Grant and wife Rogers regress to their childhood. Marilyn Monroe is also a scream as the dim-bulb secretary to Charles Coburn.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I Was a Male War Bride
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Who knew simple dinner reservations under a different name could turn one New Jersey couple's date night so terribly upside-down? Claire (Tina Fey) and Phil (Steve Carell) Foster leave their kids with the sitter (Leighton Meester) and head out for a night on the town -- as the Tripplehorns. Shawn Levy (Just Married, Night at the Museum) directs this action-comedy; Mark Wahlberg and James Franco co-star.
link.title: synopsis
I Don't Know How She Does It
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
He's Just Not That Into You

link.synopsis: Indian-American actor and stand-up comedian Arj Barker (aka Arjun Singh) takes the stage in this Comedy Central special, in which the funnyman treats an enthusiastic audience to his absurd observations about life in the modern age. No topic is too subtle, too weird or too taboo for Barker's wry and incisive sense of humor, which he delivers with a disarming blend of keen wit and sly understatement.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this affable yuppie comedy, Kate Reddy is a successful executive, wife and mom whose personal and professional lives hang in precarious balance. When Kate takes on a new job challenge, she and her brood have some serious prioritizing to do.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be Afraid of the Dark
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Sex and the City: The Movie
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck

title.regular: I Don't Know How She Does It
title.short: I Don't Know How She Does It

link.synopsis: Comedy veteran Bobby Slayton pulls out all the stops for this hourlong comedy special that finds him riffing on the differences between men and women, the general hotness of Victoria's Secret employees and other sexually charged topics. Slayton says they call him "the Pit Bull of Comedy," and there's reason to fear his bite: The brash comic clearly gets his kicks from ripping good taste and political correctness to shreds.

link.synopsis: Michael Angarano stars in this indie comedy as Sam, a naïve twentysomething who falls head over heels in love with Zoe (Uma Thurman), a beautiful older woman who's about to marry a pretentious documentary filmmaker (Lee Pace). Refusing to give up hope, Sam drags his best friend (Reece Thompson) to the seaside town where the wedding is set to take place in a last-ditch attempt to head off the nuptials.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: In director Nick Hurran's goofy comedy, Welsh funeral parlor owner Boris (Alfred Molina) is about to realize his fondest dream. His true love since childhood (Brenda Blethyn) will soon make herself available to him -- by staging her own fake death. But as part of the bargain, Boris may have to sacrifice his business to an American competitor (Christopher Walken), who wants to "put the fun back in funerals" with Vegas-style ceremonies and neon lights.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain

link.synopsis: Considering his years on "Saturday Night Live" and his second-act career success on "Weeds," you would think that Kevin Nealon would have more than a few stand-up comedy specials under his belt, but believe it or not, this is the first. Dry as a bone, Nealon is a master of the comic reversal of expectation and a man who seems to enjoy every minute of his give-and-take with the crowd. Old friend Garry Shandling puts in an appearance as well.
link.title: synopsis

title.short: Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!

link.synopsis: There's nothing like first love to bring family tensions to a boil in this dark comedy, nominated for two Independent Spirit Awards. Adam Scott stars as Caleb Sinclaire, whose emotions go haywire when his brother (Alex Frost) brings home new girlfriend Emma (Brittany Snow). As the dysfunctional family is propelled into chaos, Caleb and Emma confront their mutual distrust and attempt to resist a growing sexual attraction.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Sharp-tongued and outspoken, comedian and star of the FX firefighter comedy-drama "Rescue Me" Denis Leary brings his acerbic wit to New York's Town Hall, joined by fellow stand-up talents Lenny Clarke, Whitney Cummings and Adam Ferrara. Providing the evening's musical entertainment are the foulmouthed Leary and his backup band, the Enablers, with a special appearance by the Rehab Horns.

link.synopsis: When her two-timing husband deserts her for a toffee-nosed romance novelist, dowdy housewife Ruth Patchett goes berserk and -- aided by her mother -- sets out to methodically ruin his life in this dark comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
The Brady Bunch in the White House

link.synopsis: When a traveling carnival sets up shop in town, Justin (Thomas Middleditch) discovers the girl of his dreams, a shrewd carnie named Galaxy (Rachael Taylor). But to win over this sexy con artist's heart, Justin must get his life in order and deal with her scary boyfriend, Reggie (Dean Winters). Brant Sersen writes and directs this romantic comedy that also stars Lea Thompson, Christopher McDonald and Jason Rogel.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: Ryan Bingham (George Clooney) racks up miles flying around the country firing employees on behalf of companies. But he faces losing the job he savors to recent college grad Natalie Keener (Anna Kendrick) -- and losing the ability to escape emotional ties to anything. A connection he builds with Alex Goran (Vera Farmiga), however, might change his outlook on the future. Golden Globe winner Jason Reitman's smart comedy also stars Jason Bateman.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: Air Power: The Story of the U.S. Air Force: Up and Away 1907-1942
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
The Men Who Stare at Goats
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Stressed-out executive Walter Davis (Bruce Willis) needs a date for a business dinner with some Japanese clients. Taking his sister-in-law's cousin, Nadia (Kim Basinger), he doesn't heed the warnings not to let her drink. One champagne into the evening, Nadia goes wild, and Walter's life spins out of control. Meanwhile, Nadia's ex-boyfriend, David (John Larroquette), stalks them at every turn in director Blake Edwards's 1980s romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Meet Mike Wilson (Dameon Clarke). He's charming. He's smart. He's a serial killer -- and a very happy one, too. Determined to share the secrets of his satisfying career, Mike enlists sad-sack video store clerk Bart (Matthew Gray Gubler) as his star pupil. Mike enlightens Bart on the finer points of body disposal and other tricks of the trade, but it's not long before Mike's girlfriend catches on to his very odd job in this hilarious dark comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Behind the Mask: The Rise of Leslie Vernon
Masters of Horror: John Landis: Family
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Ed Gein: The Butcher of Plainfield
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu
Masters of Horror: Peter Medak: The Washingtonians

title.regular: How to Be a Serial Killer
title.short: How to Be a Serial Killer

link.synopsis: Recorded live at the Long Beach Terrace Theater in California, Margaret Cho's latest stand-up comedy tour is a show with a message: What makes all of us beautiful is how we feel about ourselves, not what society dictates we should feel.

link.synopsis: Beach bum Scotty McKay (Dean Cameron) strikes pay dirt when he meets dreamy Jeannie Paterson (Ami Dolenz), a kindhearted genie with the power to grant him his every desire but one -- the affection of Dana Stanford (Felicity Waterman), the superficial supermodel next door. In this comedy of unrequited love, lonely Jeannie does her best to make Dana like Scotty but discovers -- too late -- that she has fallen under her own spell.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Tired of the emotional hassles of dating and relationships, successful and beautiful pals Donna (Amber Benson) and Christi Ann (Kristen Kerr) decide to keep two unemployed New York construction workers (Johann Urb and Stevie Long) around in a "strictly sexual" capacity. The plan works like a charm -- until love starts to rear its inconvenient head in this savvy "Sex and the City"-style comedy, also starring Brooke Allen as Cassandra.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon

link.synopsis: In this saucy British comedy series, Donna (Sharon Horgan) decides to call off her wedding to her boring fianc, Karl (Cavan Clerkin), after which she promptly moves into a South London flat with her friends Karen (Tanya Franks) and Louise (Rebekah Staton) and starts taking full advantage of being single again. The show follows their wild escapades, which involve copious amounts of alcohol and some disastrous encounters with the opposite sex.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret

link.synopsis: From "Def Comedy Jam" to "Laffapalozza," irreverent comedienne Leslie Jones -- aka "Big Les" -- leaves audiences howling with laughter as she performs her raunchy style of stand-up for fans in this hilarious routine recorded live in Hollywood, Calif. The fun continues with bonus footage that takes you backstage and behind the scenes with an up-close and personal interview with the funny lady herself.

Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!

link.synopsis: After winning the lottery, lowly clerk François (Bernard Campan) asks a gorgeous prostitute to live with him until his money runs out. François's life greatly improves when Daniela (Monica Bellucci) moves in -- that is, until her pimp, Charly (Gérard Depardieu), shows up. Director Bertrand Blier's sexy comedy co-stars Jean-Pierre Darroussin and Edouard Baer.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

title.regular: How Much Do You Love Me?
title.short: How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Returning to Los Angeles to attend the funeral of a mutual acquaintance, six college friends who are now in their 30s (Miguel A. Nunez Jr, Robin Givens, Laz Alonso, Mel Jackson, Teck Holmes and Obba Babatunde) rekindle old emotions and reexamine the choices they've made. In her feature film debut, Terrah Bennett Smith directs this heartfelt comedy exploring the intricacies of love and friendship.
link.title: synopsis
Breaking Up Is Hard to Do
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Love and Other Four Letter Words
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Earthquake Presents: From the Outhouse to the White House

link.synopsis: After alcoholic hit man Frank (Ben Kingsley) botches an assignment, he leaves the Polish mob family he works for to clean up the mess and relocates to San Francisco, where he dries out, gets a job at a mortuary and falls in love with Laurel (Téa Leoni). But when a rival gang threatens the family, he returns to take care of business -- with Laurel in tow. Philip Baker Hall and Dennis Farina co-star in director John Dahl's quirky crime comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: In this musical comedy, billionaire Jean-Marc (Yves Montand) falls for showgirl Amanda (Marilyn Monroe). When Jean-Marc hears he's the subject of a spoof in a revue Amanda is rehearsing, he convinces the producers to allow him to portray himself so he can be near Amanda. Jean-Marc then hires Bing Crosby, Milton Berle and Gene Kelly (playing themselves) to teach him the tricks of the trade.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: There's No Business Like Show Business
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
The Last Time I Saw Paris
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Dolly Parton and Queen Latifah square off in this big-hearted comedy about a flat-broke town choir whose members dream of winning a national contest. However, the stars' struggle for leadership could scuttle the group's harmony and hopes of success.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: Mark McKinney, Bruce McCulloch, Dave Foley, Kevin McDonald and Scott Thompson make up a quirky sketch comedy group who indulge in pop culture parodies, celebrity impersonations -- watch for Thompson's Queen Elizabeth II -- and more. The Kids oftentimes appear as themselves rather than as characters, hilarious monologues are aplenty and courting controversy is not something with which this troupe is unaccustomed.

The Kids in the Hall: Season 1
The Kids in the Hall: Season 2
The Kids in the Hall: Season 3

link.synopsis: Carlos Mencia, Pablo Francisco and Freddy Soto headline this stand-up showcase filmed on a national comedy tour. Mencia skewers social mores, Francisco creates humor through inventive vocalizations, and Soto examines the absurdities of family life.
link.title: synopsis
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour

link.synopsis: The tradition of award-winning, British sketch comedy is alive and well in the team of David Mitchell and Robert Webb, a raucous and razor-sharp duo who specialize in pop culture parodies, mockumentaries, game show spoofs and more. Among their recurring skits are "Numberwang," about an impossibly ridiculous game show; "Lazy Writers," which looks askance at the creative process; and "The Helivets," about heroes who rescue pets in danger.
link.title: synopsis
That Mitchell and Webb Look: Series 1
That Mitchell and Webb Look: Series 2

That Mitchell and Webb Look: Series 4

The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice

link.synopsis: On a night out with the guys, Richard (Julius Golden) is approached by the sultry Angela (Jamica Sherman), who showers him with attention. It's a dream come true for any guy, but through one simple act, Richard starts his life on a downward spiral into disaster. With his life in tatters, will Richard finally discover the truth about love? Arlicia Love and Reggie Partlow co-star in this wry comedy about romance and attraction.
link.title: synopsis
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Love and Other Four Letter Words

Breaking Up Is Hard to Do
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend

link.synopsis: When three friends (Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis and Bradley Cooper) finally come to after a raucous night of bachelor-party revelry, they find a baby in the closet and a tiger in the bathroom. But they can't seem to locate their best friend, Doug (Justin Bartha) -- who's supposed to be tying the knot. Launching a frantic search for Doug, the trio perseveres through a nasty hangover to try to make it to the church on time in this Golden Globe winner for Best Comedy.
link.title: synopsis
World Wrestling Network: FIP: BYOB: The Hangover
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle

link.synopsis: With plenty of martial arts action and a hefty dose of Thai humor, this crime comedy tells the story of hapless personal bodyguard Wong Kom (writer-director Petchtai Wongkamlao). When his failure to protect his boss, successful businessman Choti, leads to the magnate's death, Choti's son fires Wong. But he soon has a chance to redeem himself when a gang of clumsy hit men -- intent on gaining control of Choti's fortune -- targets the son.
link.title: synopsis
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words

link.synopsis: When chronically overweight Lucy (Missi Pyle) invites a group of her old college pals to Montana for a weekend reunion because "time is running out," the friends assume that Lucy is at death's door, and they rush to her side in this indie comedy. But Lucy's got a few big surprises in store for them -- including a four-day backpacking trip that tests the limits of their friendship … and their sanity. Allison Janney and Melissa McCarthy co-star.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Audacious funnyman Alex Reymundo -- one of the original "Latin Kings of Comedy" and a self-professed redneck -- uncorks a no-holds-barred stand-up routine in which no one is safe from his razor-sharp wit. Dissecting life as a Mexican-American, bad-boy Reymundo packs plenty of crass and clever observations into his tales about growing up an immigrant in a large Latino family in the American South.
link.title: synopsis
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special

Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man

link.synopsis: American viewers may know him best as the British correspondent on "The Daily Show," but John Oliver is also an accomplished stand-up comic. In his first Comedy Central special Oliver tackles the topics that perplex him about the United States. He takes well-aimed shots at the American political process and the invasion of Iraq (including how the Brits would have done it differently), and argues for reparations from the Revolutionary War.
link.title: synopsis
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show

link.synopsis: Perpetually unlucky in love, June (Cameron Diaz) becomes intrigued by a mysterious man (Tom Cruise), who unexpectedly drags her into a whirlwind adventure involving devious enemies, life-threatening confrontations and a major discovery that may alter the future of humankind. Directed by James Mangold, this exhilarating action-comedy also features Peter Sarsgaard, Paul Dano, Maggie Grace and Viola Davis.
link.title: synopsis
Four Men and a Prayer / Seas Beneath
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

link.synopsis: Oscar-winning director Ron Howard serves up a delicious comedy about two best friends and business partners -- Ronny (Vince Vaughn) and Nick (Kevin James) -- who are about to land a fantastic deal when Ronny learns something about Nick's wife, Geneva (Winona Ryder), that rocks his world. Ronny turns amateur sleuth to determine whether Geneva's cheating on Nick and learns that telling a friend the truth is even more difficult than concealing it.
link.title: synopsis
Went to Coney Island on a Mission from God: Be Back By Five
He's Just Not That Into You
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Set in Los Angeles, this sardonic indie comedy helmed by Jamie Babbit follows the exploits of Anna (Melonie Diaz), a lesbian and plastic surgeon's receptionist who embarks on a wild ride when she joins a cadre of ultraradical feminists. But things get complicated when she falls in love with the group's leader (Nicole Vicius), who's already involved with someone (Melanie Mayron). Carly Pope and Lauren Mollica also star.
link.title: synopsis
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement

link.synopsis: A group of high school slackers -- stuck in detention and forced to compose a paper about the public education system's failings -- find themselves summoned to the nation's capital after sending the essay to the president in this outrageous comedy. But little does the commander in chief know that the class brainiac wrote the piece and that the students on their way to address Congress are wild party animals. Matt Frewer and Valerie Mahaffey star.
link.title: synopsis
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: Part stand-up and part one-man show, Michael McDonald's debut comedy special has the funnyman riffing on topics such as fame and family, as well as giving us a glimpse of the real person behind the kooky characters he's created for television.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When tightly wound FBI agent Wendell Everett (Don Cheadle) invades an Irish village in pursuit of international drug dealers, wisecracking local copper Gerry Boyle (Brendan Gleeson) does his best to annoy the American and get on with his circumscribed life. But soon there's a murder, and Boyle finds himself swept up in detective work way beyond his pay grade. John Michael McDonagh directs this action-filled comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I Don't Know How She Does It

link.synopsis: Stephen Surjik directs this comedy starring Tom Riley and Tom Burke as two film school students whose first movie goes awry. Desperate to finance their flick, Joe and Baggy turn to a pornography producer who puts up the cash -- that is, if the duo can get semi-retired adult film actress Candy (Carmen Electra) to star. She agrees to do it, and soon their earnest script morphs into a raunchy show shot in Joe's parents' suburban home on the sly.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: In this contemporary, Florida-set retelling of the ancient Greek comedy "Lysistrata," a young woman (Trina) concocts an ingenious method of cutting down on the crime and gang violence in her neighborhood -- by convincing her girlfriends to withhold sex from their gangster boyfriends until the violence stops! But the plan doesn't go so smoothly, resulting instead in a battle of the sexes that just may change Miami forever.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Just Another Girl on the I.R.T.
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Five on the Black Hand Side
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me

link.synopsis: This politically infused comedy follows the crusade of Baya, a left-wing femme fatale who seeks to rescue right-wing men from their conservative values by taking them on as lovers -- until she meets a man whose beliefs are as firmly set as her own.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Forced to marry Camille (Sienna Miller), the sheriff's niece, parolee Silas (James Franco) takes his bride on a Niagara Falls honeymoon, where he plans to escape to Canada. Certain the trip will rehabilitate Silas, Camille remains enthusiastic -- even after she dies in a crash. Now, Silas must deal with Camille's denial about her death and her slow decomposition. David Carradine co-stars in this quirky romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: In this comedy of errors, soon-to-be father Mel Coplin sets out to find his birth parents, accompanied by his wife and sexy female adoption agent. Their quest becomes even more anarchic once drug dealers and a pair of gay FBI agents get involved.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Realizing that his chances of becoming a movie star are increasingly slim, aspiring actor Ross Vegas (Ross Patterson) turns his focus to bowling, and before long he's anointed as the PBA's newest rising star. Tommy Reid directs this quirky, low-budget comedy that also stars Tara Reid as Ross's girlfriend, Lindsay, Clayne Crawford as his wisecracking best friend, Mike, and Vinnie Jones (Snatch) as bowling tour bad boy Roddy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Stand-up comedian Doug Benson has trouble keeping his mouth shut in this Comedy Central series (based on the stage show of the same name) that finds him interrupting his friends on stage -- and on purpose -- while they perform their sets.
link.title: synopsis
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Nick Kroll: Thank You Very Cool
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away

link.synopsis: When his father is killed in a bizarre sports accident, wrong-side-of-the-tracks Henry O'Shea (Joseph Cross) quits nursing school to earn cash as a doorman at a posh New York apartment building, where he falls for lovely resident Scarlett Dowling (Sarah Roemer). As the pair's relationship progresses, Henry's sister (Rachael Leigh Cook) encourages the romance, but Scarlett's mother has other ideas. David M. Rosenthal directs this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Comedy writer Christopher Morris makes his feature directorial debut with this outrageous comedy about a group of young Islamic Brits who fancy themselves bloodthirsty jihadis of the first order. The film showcases Morris's satirical talents at their vicious best in a scathingly hilarious indictment of true believers and the social systems that create them. Viewers took note and bestowed it the Audience Award for Best Narrative Feature at the L.A. Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
A Film with Me in It
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Four days before the bar exam, ambitious legal intern Rick Robinson (Ben Gourley) makes a promise to his boss, McAllister (Rutger Hauer), and finds himself on a cross-country road trip from hell with McAllister's niece (Mila Kunis) and her pet pig in this comedy. En route from Miami to L.A., Robinson is set off course by hitchhikers, breakdowns and even love on a journey that proves that there's more to life than making it to the exam on time.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Feeling abandoned by her therapist who's gone on an extended vacation, beautiful Lindsay (Estella Warren) gets help with her fear of commitment from an ad hoc support group formed by other New Yorkers also left high and dry by their shrinks. But when her pals dare her to date fellow group member A.J. (Justin Kirk), Lindsay begins to wonder if she's finally found her match. Tamara Tunie directs this charming romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Successful perfume executive Luis (Alain Chabat) is happily single, but his mother and sisters want him to settle down. After they arrange a string of disastrous blind dates, Luis concocts a crazy scheme that will make his family happy without his getting married. All he needs to do is hire a girl to act as his fiancée and then dump him at the altar. But when Luis meets Emmanuelle, the plan takes a turn he never anticipated in this French comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?

title.regular: I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
title.short: I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: Focusing on the lives of five African American professionals, BET's original scripted comedy mines laughs from the highs and lows of modern relationships and the mistakes everyone makes when it comes to love.
link.title: synopsis
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Kimora: Life in the Fab Lane
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman

link.synopsis: After barely surviving an intensely grueling boot camp in Uzbekistan, an eclectic group of recently enlisted Soviet soldiers ships off to fight in Afghanistan, where they must endure hellish conditions and extremely dangerous Mujahideen forces. Based on a true story from the 1980s, this rousing Russian war film about camaraderie and heroism stars Aleksey Chadov, Artur Smolyaninov and Konstantin Kryukov.
link.title: synopsis
As Far as My Feet Will Carry Me
The Wind That Shakes the Barley
The Charge of the Light Brigade

link.synopsis: As the rest of humankind succumbs to a virus that turns them into flesh-eating zombies, three pals (Morgan Williams, Robert Faith and Ashleigh Southam) not only survive but thrive -- enjoying the easy pickings of a deserted landscape. All of that changes, however, when they meet a pretty girl. Now, the guys' inner heroes get a chance to emerge in this zombie comedy from New Zealand as they help the lovely young scientist in her race to find a cure.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Masters of Horror: Tobe Hooper: Dance of the Dead
Death Valley: The Revenge of Bloody Bill
Masters of Horror: Joe Dante: Homecoming

link.synopsis: This modern take on the 1971 series by the same name blends animation and skits to keep children entertained -- and teaches them new words via a blend of hip-hop and R&B music. Whoopi Goldberg, Ne-Yo and more appear as guests.
link.title: synopsis
Postcards from Buster: The Case of the Coin Purloined: Fort Leonard Wood, Missouri
Martha Speaks: Martha Goes to School
Martha Speaks: Martha Says It with Flowers
The Adventures of Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids
Adventures from the Book of Virtues
Rubbadubbers: High Noon in the Bathroom
Rubbadubbers: Finbar the Mighty Movie Star
The Wubbulous World of Dr. Seuss
The Littles: Here Comes the Littles

link.synopsis: After leaving Iowa with stars in her eyes, Ali (Christina Aguilera) arrives in Los Angeles and at a burlesque lounge, where she dreams of taking the stage with her soaring voice. Club owner Tess (Cher) is about to lose the place and thinks Ali may help business. Meanwhile, Ali's roommate (Cam Gigandet) starts to fall for her in this snappy, Golden Globe-nominated comedy co-starring Stanley Tucci as Tess's sidekick and Kristen Bell as Ali's rival.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque
The Phantom of the Opera: Special Edition
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story

link.synopsis: Set in significant time periods from the Dark Ages through World War I, this hilarious British comedy recounts the adventures of Edmund Blackadder (Rowan Atkinson), the most despicable and brilliant rogue ever to pursue a coin or a pretty girl.  Accompanied by his dim and smelly servant, Baldrick (Tony Robinson), Blackadder endeavors to get rich while serving an assortment of idiotic monarchs. Miranda Richardson, Hugh Laurie and Stephen Fry co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Doctor Who: The Ark in Space
Doctor Who: The Androids of Tara
Doctor Who: The City of Death
Doctor Who: Horror of Fang Rock
Doctor Who: The Caves of Androzani
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Warrior of the Lost World

link.synopsis: A wry look at the insanity of married life, this offbeat comedy follows the ups and downs of a whirlwind romance between the brilliant yet neurotic Ira Black (Chris Messina) and the free-spirited but flaky Abby Willoughby (Jennifer Westfeldt). Hastily married after knowing each other for only a few short hours, Ira and Abby battle a series of misadventures that forces them to question just how real their love is.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Sexy pinup Nikki Ziering travels to three spring break hot spots to enjoy some fun in the sun in this National Lampoon's comedy, a wet and wild flick that brings viewers into the thick of the ultimate drunken spring break bash. From Las Vegas to Cabo San Lucas and South Padre Island, Ziering parties like there's no tomorrow with body shots, hummer rides, hot coeds, booze cruises, tequila slides and more. Diego Garcia and Brian Shukoff co-star.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile

link.synopsis: When he throws one last booze-fueled, babe-filled fraternity party the night before his wedding, Duffy (Randy Wayne) feels his resolve to be faithful to his gal Adriana (Caroline D'Amore) slipping away faster than a brew down a beer bong. Now, Duffy must resist the siren song of naked co-eds and other lusty temptations if he hopes to meet Adriana at the altar. Robert Bennett directs this bawdy comedy that also features adult-film star Jesse Jane.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile

link.synopsis: Jim Jarmusch's ensemble comedy collects a series of strange encounters Jarmusch has been capturing in short films since the mid-1980s, presenting them as a series of vignettes that all revolve around discussions held over coffee and cigarettes.
link.title: synopsis
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

link.synopsis: Derrick (B. Cole) decides to throw a couples-only gathering at his place so he can spend some quality time with his new girlfriend. But Derrick's single friend Jay calls up everyone in the neighborhood and turns the small get-together into a raging party. Derrick is upset with his best friend at first, but it's hard to stay mad when everybody is having so much fun in this frothy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2

link.synopsis: Perhaps best known for his connection to the Monty Python comedies, writer, director and actor Terry Jones hosts this compelling documentary from filmmaker Nick Murphy, exploring one of humankind's most influential inventions: the number 1. After all, without the creation of that ingenious single-digit stroke, we wouldn't have the capacity to count the millions of ways in which humans have changed the world through mathematics ever since.
link.title: synopsis
Terry Jones: The Hidden History of Rome
Terry Jones: The Hidden History of Egypt
Michael Wood: In Search of Myths and Heroes
National Geographic: The Gospel of Judas
Japan: Memoirs of a Secret Empire
Great Artists Two with Tim Marlow
Matter of Life and Death: Magic Moments and Dark Hours in the History of Medicine
Empires: The Medici, Godfathers of the Renaissance
The Future We Will Create: Inside the World of TED
Ancient Mysteries: The Miraculous Canals of Venice
National Geographic: Stress: Portrait of a Killer
Ancient Mysteries: Lost Castles of England
H.H. Holmes: America's First Serial Killer
National Geographic: Secrets of Jerusalem's Holiest Sites
History's Mysteries: True Story of Rasputin
Ken Burns' America: Empire of the Air

link.synopsis: Beethoven, the beloved St. Bernard from the original 1992 comedy, is back -- and this time, he has a whole brood with him now that he's met his canine match, Missy, and fathered a family. The only problem is that Missy's owner, Regina (Debi Mazar), wants to sell the puppies and tear the clan apart. It's up to Beethoven and the Newton kids to save the day and keep everyone together. Co-stars Charles Grodin and Bonnie Hunt.
link.title: synopsis
The Land Before Time IX: Journey to Big Water
For the Love of a Dog
The Land Before Time VII: Stone of Cold Fire
The Land Before Time X: The Great Longneck Migration
Romeo & Juliet: Sealed with a Kiss
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody
Chased by Dinosaurs: Three Walking with Dinosaurs Adventures
VeggieTales: Pistachio: The Little Boy That Woodn't
Barney: Let's Go to the Farm
Allosaurus: A Walking with Dinosaurs Special
Bob the Builder: The LIVE Show

link.synopsis: Six young people spend the morning after a wild club spree trying to piece together their misadventures from the night before, including a trip to the veterinarian hospital, at least one breakup and the unexpected discovery of a mobster's corpse. As the group shares their fragmented memories, some of their stories start to fit together while others just lead to more questions. Bijou Phillips and Patrick Flueger star in the romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: Philip Seymour Hoffman directs and stars in this romantic comedy about Jack, a marijuana-smoking Manhattan limo driver who begins an unlikely regimen of self-improvement to win the heart of a fellow misfit named Connie (Amy Ryan). But as Jack learns to cook and swim for the benefit of his girl, he also witnesses the breakup of his best friends' marriage. John Ortiz and Daphne Rubin-Vega co-star in this adaptation of Bob Glaudini's play.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Writer-director Jeff Daniels also stars in this offbeat comedy about a family of hunting enthusiasts in backwoods Michigan. The pressure is on for 43-year-old Rueben: If he doesn't bag a buck this year, he'll be the Soady clan's biggest failure. Rueben thinks that adopting some new rituals -- such as anointing himself with porcupine urine -- may change his luck, but all they seem to do is set off a string of eerie supernatural events.
link.title: synopsis
The Ranger, the Cook, and a Hole in the Sky
Some Folks Call It a Sling Blade
A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque

link.synopsis: A sleepy village in the country seems like the perfect hideout for a failed assassin (Damian Lewis) who's trying his best to avoid his angry employers. That is, until the locals assume he's the new baker they've hired, and promptly put him to work. Forget what he might have been asked to do in the past ... this new gig is no piece of cake. Michael Gambon and Kate Ashfield co-star in this quirky comedy with plenty of bite.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Joni (Mia Wasikowska) and Laser (Josh Hutcherson), the children of same-sex parents Nic (Annette Bening) and Jules (Julianne Moore), become curious about the identity of their sperm-donor dad (Mark Ruffalo) and set out to make him part of their family unit, often with hilarious results. But his arrival complicates the household dynamics, and nobody is sure how he fits in -- if at all -- in this Oscar-nominated, Golden Globe-winning comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work

link.synopsis: Monty (Rodney Dangerfield), the world's biggest nebbish and a man with more nasty personal habits than you can count, has one year to change his ways or he stands to lose a fortune he would otherwise inherit vis-a-vis his mother-in-law's will. Trouble is, Clive (Tom Ewell) will stop at nothing to stop Monty. This comedy showcases Rodney in rare form, with a supporting cast that includes Geraldine Fitzgerald, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Joe Pesci.
link.title: synopsis
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: Back in college, Greg (Mark Feuerstein) was in a seven-man a cappella group. Now, he's getting hitched and invites his old friends to reunite and perform at the wedding. They haven't sung together in 15 years, but rusty pipes aren't their only problem. Failed marriages, flagging careers and missed opportunities hang over their heads -- but the reunion may be the perfect solution. Molly Shannon co-stars in this award-winning ensemble comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Brit Matt Berry and Yank Rich Fulcher play a hangman and his assistant, respectively, in this exceedingly dark BBC comedy series. With much of the action taking place at "a gentleman's club for hangmen," the lads run into awkward situations aplenty.
link.title: synopsis
Andy Richter Controls the Universe: The Complete Series
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
The Worst Week of My Life
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
The Best of So Graham Norton
Daria: The Movie: Is It Fall Yet?
The 2005 Academy Award Short Films Collection
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
The Best of Comedy Central Presents
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story

link.synopsis: Walter Brennan stars in this heartwarming classic as Matt Ballot, a reformed alcoholic who's returning home to rural Arkansas to be with his family more than a decade after leaving them behind to fend for themselves. But convincing his wife (Ann Sheridan), who's raised their two children (Sherry Jackson and Richard Eyer) on her own, to trust him -- not to mention the rest of the town -- won't be an easy task.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit

link.synopsis: When his drug-addled pal Bug (Stephen Eric McIntyre) gets out of the slammer circa 1983 and discovers newfangled ATM machines for the first time, petty-crime mastermind Dick (Timothy Olyphant) hits on an idea for pulling his first (successful) bank heist. But just as Dick's misfit crew puts his foolproof plan into motion, things go wildly haywire. This black comedy from director Gary Yates co-stars Rossif Sutherland and Joe Anderson.
link.title: synopsis
Shoot First and Pray You Live
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: Recasting the 1981 comedy classic starring Dudley Moore, this romantic chuckler chronicles the dilemma faced by philanderer Arthur Bach (Russell Brand) -- whether to give up a respectable life and an inheritance of millions for the sake of romance. Jennifer Garner co-stars as Susan Johnson, the gorgeous socialite that Arthur's family has chosen for him. Greta Gerwig plays Naomi, the girl who steals Arthur's heart in the meantime.
link.title: synopsis
The Young, the Gay and the Restless
Russell Brand in New York City

link.synopsis: It's the Big Day for Wilson and Maura, and Freddie is tying the knot with Sophie -- for the second time. But with both couples' receptions set for the same hotel, the stage is set for a hilarious screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Writer-director Richard Curtis's charming treatise on romance and relationships is an all-star ensemble comedy that tells 10 separate (but intertwining) London love stories, leading up to a spirited climax on Christmas Eve. One of the threads follows the newly installed Prime Minister (Hugh Grant), who, on his first day in 10 Downing Street, falls in love with the luminous girl (Martine McCutcheon) who brings him his tea.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
When Did You Last See Your Father?
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: After tailing his dream girl into a sex addict support group meeting, Andy (Josh Cooke) concocts a fake identity and tries to fit in. But as he woos the object of his desire, the fake sexaholic struggles to keep his real life from falling apart. Directed by Lawrence Trilling, this outrageous romantic comedy co-stars Greg Grunberg (who co-wrote the screenplay) and features Tom Arnold, Lisa Lampanelli and Henry Winkler.
link.title: synopsis
